unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explain the key Big Data concepts and techniques.
Apply techniques for storing large volumes of data.
Apply techniques for handling high-dimensional big data.
Apply Map-reduce techniques to a number of problems that involve Big Data.

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp at 1000 level or above including COMP2200 or COMP257

assessments.description: The final exam will focus on the theoretical aspects of the unit, including algorithms and implementation issues.
In this assignment you will implement MapReduce techniques for the processing of Big Data. You will build your assignment on top of Hadoop.
In this assignment you will implement a non-trivial problem that processes Big Data.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description:
Even simple tasks like counting elements can seem impossible when the amount of data to process is huge. This unit explores some of the key
aspects related to processing and mining information from large volumes of data. We present technology commonly used in industry such as map-reduce, and show how a range of data processing methods can be realised using map-reduce. Special emphasis will be placed in the adaptation of data mining techniques for large volumes of data and for data streaming.
data.title: Big Data

title: Big Data
